title: Why recycling could be the biggest trend in fine jewellery, and where to go for a gemstone makeover
text:
Jewellery isn’t sustainable in the way that, say, a renewable crop might be. You can replant cotton, but you can’t replant gold or natural diamonds or other nature-made gemstones – they’ve taken millions of years to be produced, and we’re not waiting around that long for the next lot.

What jewellery is primed for, however, is recycling. It’s hardly a new thing, trying to keep up with the sustainability Joneses. In fact, jewellery is so recyclable, it’s a nightmare for auction houses, collectors and historians, as so few historic pieces survive changing tastes, fortunes, ownership and any other circumstances that befall them over the centuries.
